sentences.chinese: 梁孝王武者，孝文皇帝子也，而與孝景帝同母。
sentences.literal: Prince Xiao of Liang, Liu Wu, was a son of Emperor Xiaowen, and shared the same mother as Emperor Xiaojing.
Their mother was Empress Dowager Dou.

sentences.chinese: 孝文帝凡四男：長子曰太子，是為孝景帝；
sentences.literal: Emperor Xiaowen had four sons altogether: the eldest son was the Crown Prince, who became Emperor Xiaojing;

sentences.chinese: 孝文帝即位二年，以武為代王，以參為太原王，以勝為梁王。
sentences.literal: Emperor Xiaowen ascended the throne in year 2, enfeoffing Wu as King of Dai, Shen as King of Taiyuan, Sheng as King of Liang.
Two years later, he transferred the King of Dai to be King of Huaiyang.

sentences.chinese: 以代盡與太原王，號曰代王。
sentences.literal: He gave all of Dai to the King of Taiyuan, who was then titled King of Dai.

sentences.chinese: 參立十七年，孝文後二年卒，謚為孝王。
sentences.literal: Shen reigned seventeen years, died in the second year after Xiaowen, posthumous title King Xiao.
His son Deng succeeded him, becoming King Gong of Dai.

sentences.chinese: 立二十九年，元光二年卒。
sentences.literal: He reigned twenty-nine years, died in Yuanguang year 2.
His son Yi succeeded him, becoming King of Dai.

sentences.chinese: 十九年，漢廣關，以常山為限，而徙代王王清河。
sentences.literal: Nineteen years later, Han expanded the passes, using Changshan as the boundary, and transferred the King of Dai to rule Qinghe.

sentences.chinese: 清河王徙以元鼎三年也。
sentences.literal: The King of Qinghe's transfer was in Yuanding year 3.
